intro: Phlegmariurus brachystachys, commonly known as the short-stalked thyme moss, is a species of moss belonging to the family Pottiaceae. It is characterized by its dense, cushion-like growth form and small, closely packed leaves. The leaves are typically narrow and have a distinctive, slightly curved shape. This moss thrives in rocky or sandy soils, often found in shaded, moist environments. It is a common epiphytic or lithophytic species, contributing to the biodiversity of forest and alpine ecosystems.
